attributes.action: Permit gyms to be reopened for the under forties throughout Covid-19 shutdown
attributes.additional_details: because of the substantial benefits of allowing people to work out which includes:-helping body to produce endorphins &  reduce stress.The possible reduction in domestic violence.Physical activity may also help flush bacteria out of the lungs and airways(this could reduce the severity covid-19 symptoms.Exercise causes change in antibodies and white blood cells:immune system cells that fight infectious disease.Studies suggest that exercising in a group is better for mental and physical health.
attributes.background: I would like to make a formal request to the UK government to permit gyms and leisure centres to be reopened for the under forties. My justification for this is based on global statistics reflecting that only 4% of infected people under forties need hospitalisation. I am putting this request forward

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition, the Government has eased restrictions allowing gyms and leisure centres to re-open. 

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
